list_variables.description: The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an ALARM state                   from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Number (ARN).                   For more information about creating alarms and the actions you can specify, see                      Creating Amazon CloudWatch                      Alarms in the Amazon CloudWatch Developer Guide.
list_variables.name: AlarmActions

list_variables.description: The dimensions for the alarm's associated metric.
list_variables.name: Dimensions

list_variables.description: The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an                   INSUFFICIENT_DATA state from any other state. Each action is specified as an                   Amazon Resource Number (ARN). Currently the only action supported is publishing to                   an Amazon SNS topic or an Amazon Auto Scaling policy.
list_variables.name: InsufficientDataActions

list_variables.description: The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an OK state                   from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Number (ARN).                   Currently the only action supported is publishing to an Amazon SNS topic or an                   Amazon Auto Scaling policy.
list_variables.name: OKActions

variables.description: Indicates whether or not actions should be executed during any changes to the                   alarm's state.
variables.name: ActionsEnabled

variables.description: A name for the alarm. If you don't specify a name, AWS CloudFormation generates a unique                   physical ID and uses that ID for the alarm name. For more information, see Name Type.
variables.name: AlarmName

variables.description: The arithmetic operation to use when comparing the specified Statistic and                   Threshold. The specified Statistic value is used as the first operand.
variables.name: ComparisonOperator

variables.description: The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified                   threshold.
variables.name: EvaluationPeriods

variables.description: The name for the alarm's associated metric. For more information about the                   metrics that you can specify, see Amazon CloudWatch Namespaces, Dimensions, and Metrics Reference in the                      Amazon CloudWatch Developer Guide.
variables.name: MetricName

variables.description: The namespace for the alarm's associated metric.
variables.name: Namespace

variables.description: The time over which the specified statistic is applied. You must specify a time                   in seconds that is also a multiple of 60.
variables.name: Period

variables.description: The statistic to apply to the alarm's associated metric.
variables.name: Statistic

variables.description: The value against which the specified statistic is compared.
variables.name: Threshold

variables.description: The unit for the alarm's associated metric.
variables.name: Unit
